Filter variants by count thresholds

Source: R/data-wrangling.R
filter_by_counts.Rd

Removes variants with total counts outside specified bounds and optionally excludes specific sample patterns.

Usage

filter_by_counts(
  data,
  min_counts = 10,
  max_counts = Inf,
  exclude_pattern = "_0_",
  sample_pattern = "count"
)

Arguments

data

A data frame with count data.

min_counts

Minimum total count to retain (default: 10).

max_counts

Maximum total count to retain (default: Inf).

exclude_pattern

Pattern for columns to exclude from output (default: "0"). Set to NULL to keep all columns.

sample_pattern

Pattern to identify sample columns for count summation (default: "count").

Value

Filtered data frame with variants meeting count criteria.

Details

This function calculates the total count for each variant across all sample columns matching sample_pattern using starts_with(), then filters to retain only variants within the specified count range. Optionally removes columns matching exclude_pattern (e.g., day 0 samples).

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
filtered_data <- filter_by_counts(
  data = count_data,
  min_counts = 10,
  exclude_pattern = "_0_"
)
} # }
